review_title: Good perks / lack of diversity and inclusion
pros:
Good salary
Good benefits. 
Good work life balance
cons:
No foreigners in top management position.
No flexi time. 
Financial service culture not tech culture.

review_title: Great company with few areas to improve
pros: Large organization with lots if opportunities for growth and collaboration.
cons: Slow processes, slow promotion cycle and complicated KPIs
Things are changing in the last years

pros: Smart and kind people, interesting industry
The company is very understanding when it comes to the needs of the employees, they are also very approachable and very lenient to work schedule or LOA.
cons: It could have been better if there would be an increase with the pay, especially now that basic commodities are getting expensive.

pros: I learned a lot was allowed to grow knowledge wise as a chargeback analyst.
cons: no room for advancement. They are quick to hire or promote management that does not have the experience to do the job or manage the department effectively.

pros:
Competitive salary 
Performance Bonus 
Good Benefits
cons: None that I can think of

pros: great environment and moves fast and lots of room for career growth within the organization
cons: hard to be onboarded due to large organizations and complex team structures
Can be more transparent with strategy

job_title: Senior Manager, Corporate Development in Norwalk, CA
pros: Long tenure of some key employees
The salary was great but MM
cons: Too much of MM was there.

job_title: Senior Manager Marketing Operations in Chicago, IL
pros: Autonomy, growth opportunities, great benefits packages
cons: Base pay can be at lower end of market

pros: There is a high quality of employee coworkers.

job_title: Account Manager in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Open working environment. Many learning opportunities.
cons: Can't think of any cons here.

review_title: Brand companies are great; headquarters is... well, not.
pros:
Travel company = interesting information about global destinations
Innovative leadership at the brand level
Opportunity for advancement and growth, if you know the right people
cons:
Being in your seat at designated time > your work product
Micromanagement occurs in every department
Reluctant to change

pros: I am fairly new at this company but I must say I am impressed. These guys really care about their employees and I feel right at home. Everyone is very welcoming and very competent in what they do.
cons: The same for every Holdings company, all the brands sometimes can be a lot of work!

review_title: Work Hard and Share the Success - These People Know What They are Doing
pros:
Great compensation and benefits.
Fast moving pace
Incredibly intelligent co-workers
This company values its employees
International focus is highly attractive
cons:
Sometimes frustrating due to multiple brands 
Somewhat hierarchical

pros: I had a 10 week internship at Priceline Group summer of 2016 and the experience was awesome. Really great people.
cons: I have no cons to report
